newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia shares ease back on low turnover.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia shares ease back on low turnover.

text.p: Slovenian shares eased 0.38 percent on Friday on low turnover amid a lack of trading incentives, traders said.

"The market is desperate for some information concerning future of foreign investments. Turnover will stay at similar levels until fresh information about the issue becomes available," one trader said.
* The SBI index fell 5.35 points to 1,390.99.
* Overall six shares fell, eight rose and three were unchanged, while nine were untraded.
* Bank SKB was the most active share, falling 1.70 percent to 55,050 tolars on volume of 402 shares. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
